intro: Oionychion, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant belonging to the genus Cistus in the family Cistaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, often with a strong, spicy fragrance. Oionychion is typically shrub-like, with woody stems and small, leathery leaves. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to withstand drought conditions.
